dataset.title: Monitoring permafrost thaw in Denali National Park and Preserve: year one of data collection 2013

address.deliveryPoint: 220 Bartram Hall; Department of Biology; University of Florida
University of Florida Department of Botany 220 Bartram Hall

abstract.para: Transects were established at six sites in the Toklat river basin, Denali National Park and Preserve. This was the fist year of what will be a long-term monitoring project of permafrost and ecosystem characteristics. Transects were co-located with known thaw subsidence (thermokarst) features and run from outside (relatively undisturbed tundra) through the feature.

section.title: Access to Data
section.para: While metadata will be freely available to those requesting it, the data manager will assure that any restrictions on access to data sets in the database will be enforced. Data will not be released without proper permission first being obtained from the investigator who generated the data.

section.title: Use of data
section.para: Researchers should receive adequate acknowledgment for the use of their data by others and should be provided with copies of publications using their data. Users of data from the data base must be aware that data is not to be sold or redistributed.

section.title: Citing Bonanza Creek LTER Datasets
section.para: It is considered a matter of professional ethics to acknowledge the work of other scientists. Thus, the Data User will properly cite the Data Set in any publications or in the metadata of any derived data products that were produced using the Data Set.

section.title: corrections
section.para: GPS data was processed using guidelines in AK RTK User Guide or 2013 DENA RTK Protocol; NDVI data were processed using PixelWrench2 v.1.8.0.4 according to Schuur lab protocol updated July 2013

section.title: Experimental Design
section.para: Sampling sites were chosen non-randomly based on aerial photographs from a fly-over on July 11, 2013. All sampling sites were located in the Toklat basin and were selected for thermokarst features.

section.title: Methods
section.para: At each sampling site, transects were placed in areas of active permafrost thaw and extended to where future thaw is predicted. Transects were 100 m long except in the burn area, in which case two 50 m transects were set up in parallel burned and unburned areas. A 1 m^2 quadrat was established looking down each transect- from meter 0 to meter 50 or 100- on the right hand side of each 5m mark. Elevation (using a differential GPS) and thaw depth were measured every 5 m along the transect. NDVI and the height of the tallest shrub were measured inside the quadrat. Organic layer depth was measured 1 m beyond (down the transect, so at the 6m mark instead of 5m) where elevation and thaw depth were measured. Instrumentation used: Trimble R8 RTK (GPS), Tetracam ADC (NDVI).

otherEntity.entityDescription: At each sampling site, transects were placed in areas of active permafrost thaw and extended to where future thaw is predicted.
